attributes.action: Make the £80 per month uplift to Universal Credit permanent.
attributes.additional_details: To withdraw it will make the already precarious financial position of the most vulnerable members of our society, particularly those who cannot, or have great difficulty working, such as the sick and single parents of small children, much worse.  Increasing the national living wage will not compensate for its removal, and in any event will reduce entitlement to Universal Credit.
attributes.background: Confirm that the uplift will be incorporated, permanently, into the standard rate of Universal Credit, for all present and future claimants of Universal Credit.
